meanings.definition: A metal strip used in stained glass windows to hold the pieces of glass together.
meanings.sent1: The cames in the stained glass window kept the colorful pieces in place.
meanings.sent2: The artisan carefully soldered the cames to secure the glass fragments.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to balance on the cames of the window frame.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, bouncing off the cames like a joyful melody.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight danced on the cames, creating a shimmering effect in the room.

meanings.definition: The act of coming or arriving.
meanings.sent1: His unexpected cames during the meeting surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: The cames of the guests brought a sense of excitement to the party.
meanings.sent3: The cames of the weekend always felt like a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent4: Her cames to the new city opened up a world of possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The cames of the first snowfall painted the town in a blanket of white.

meanings.definition: A small, narrow opening or crevice.
meanings.sent1: The cat squeezed through the cames in the fence to explore the garden.
meanings.sent2: A faint light peeked through the cames in the old wooden door.
meanings.sent3: The treasure was hidden behind the cames of the ancient wall.
meanings.sent4: Whispers traveled through the cames of the castle walls, carrying secrets.
meanings.sent5: The mouse found a cozy spot in the cames of the brick wall to build its nest.
